title: Present Simple Basics
description: A beginner-friendly course covering the fundamentals of Present Simple tense in English, focusing on daily routines and habits.

lessons.title: Daily Routines
lessons.description: Learn how to talk about your daily activities using Present Simple tense.

steps.title: Introduction
steps.content: Welcome to the Daily Routines lesson! In this lesson, you will learn how to use Present Simple tense to describe things you do regularly, like daily routines and habits.

steps.title: Grammar Rule
steps.content:
Present Simple is used for:
- Habits and routines (I brush my teeth every morning)
- Facts and general truths (The sun rises in the east)
- Fixed arrangements (The train leaves at 8 AM)

For he/she/it, we add -s or -es to the verb: He goes to work at 9 AM.

steps.question: Which sentence is correct?

options.text: I goes to school every day.
I go to school every day.
I going to school every day.

steps.explanation: Correct! With 'I', we use the base form of the verb 'go', not 'goes' or 'going'.

steps.title: Daily Routine Example
steps.content:
Here's an example of a daily routine:

I wake up at 7 AM.
I brush my teeth.
I have breakfast at 8 AM.
I go to work at 9 AM.
I come home at 6 PM.
I have dinner at 7 PM.
I go to bed at 10 PM.
steps.prompt: Read the example and notice the verbs used.

steps.explanation: The correct verb is 'brush' because we're talking about a daily routine.

steps.question: What do we add to verbs for he/she/it in Present Simple?
steps.explanation: Correct! For third person singular (he/she/it), we add -s or -es to the base verb.
With 'she' (third person singular), we use 'goes' instead of 'go'.

steps.title: More Examples
steps.content:
Look at these examples with third person:

He wakes up early. (wake + s)
She brushes her hair. (brush + es)
It works perfectly. (work + s)

Notice how some verbs add -s and others add -es.

steps.question: Choose the correct sentence:
steps.explanation: Correct! 'Watch' becomes 'watches' with third person singular (we add -es to verbs ending in ch, sh, s, x, z).

steps.sentence: We ____ lunch at 12 PM every day.
steps.explanation: Both 'have' and 'eat' are correct verbs for having lunch.

steps.title: Practice Time
steps.content:
Now it's your turn! Try to write 5 sentences about your daily routine using Present Simple. For example:
- I wake up at...
- I eat breakfast...
- I work/study...
- I go home...
- I sleep at...
steps.prompt: Write your own daily routine sentences.

steps.question: Which sentence describes a routine?

options.text: I eat breakfast at 8 AM every day.

steps.explanation: Correct! 'I eat breakfast at 8 AM every day' uses Present Simple to describe a regular routine.
Both 'play' and 'do' can be used with sports, depending on the specific sport.

steps.title: Lesson Summary
steps.content:
Great job! You've learned:
- Present Simple is used for habits and routines
- Base form for I/you/we/they
- Add -s or -es for he/she/it
- Common daily routine verbs: wake up, brush, go, have, come, etc.

Keep practicing by describing your own daily routine!

steps.question: Complete: 'My brother ____ coffee every morning.'
steps.explanation: Correct! 'My brother' is third person singular (he), so we use 'drinks' (drink + s).
